page.title: 01Introduction: W of E'bourne
page.content: This is predominantly a rural area, though with small areas of residential housing in the east (East Dean) and the west (Meads). We therefore identified five major topics which needed to be covered in detail. 1. The Ecology of the Downs _ the area contains a variety of plant and animal life, both natural and farmed. 2. Farming _ much of the area is covered by three farms which specialise in both arable farming and animal husbandry. 3. Tourism _ the economy of Eastbourne depends heavily on holiday makers attracted by the sea, the Downs and the healthy climate of the area. 4. Housing _ both East Dean and Meads are much sought-after middle class residential areas. 5. Education _ there are now several independent schools here.
